meanings.definition: A tree or shrub of the genus Acacia, typically with yellow or white flowers.
meanings.sent1: The acacia in our garden has beautiful yellow flowers.
meanings.sent2: I love the shade under the acacia tree in the park.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels play hide-and-seek around the acacia tree.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as bright as the yellow acacia blooms.
meanings.sent5: The scent of the acacia flowers filled the air with sweetness.

meanings.definition: A gum obtained from various species of acacia trees, used in the production of adhesives and inks.
meanings.sent1: The acacia gum is sticky and useful for making glue.
meanings.sent2: The bookbinding industry relies on acacia for its adhesive properties.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally stepped on the acacia gum and got stuck!
meanings.sent4: Her words were like acacia gum, binding us together with their sincerity.
meanings.sent5: The acacia gum added a glossy finish to the artwork.

meanings.definition: A color resembling the pale yellow of acacia flowers.
meanings.sent1: She painted her room in a soft acacia hue.
meanings.sent2: The artist mixed yellow and white to create the perfect acacia shade.
meanings.sent3: The acacia-colored curtains brightened up the room instantly.
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up her face like the warm acacia color.
meanings.sent5: The acacia paint brought a touch of nature indoors.
